description: Centralized FDA Pre-Submission question bank with 35+ questions across 10 categories

questions.text: Does FDA agree that {predicate_k_numbers} ({predicate_device_names}) {is_are} an appropriate predicate device{s} for our {device_description_short}? If not, can FDA recommend alternative predicate(s)?
questions.rationale: Core SE question - FDA must confirm predicate acceptability before submission strategy finalizes

questions.text: Our proposed predicate {primary_predicate_k_number} was cleared {years_ago} years ago. Does FDA recommend we consider more recent predicates, or is this acceptable given {similarity_rationale}?
questions.rationale: Older predicates may have outdated testing expectations - FDA input prevents RTA

questions.text: We believe our device is appropriately classified under product code {product_code} (21 CFR {regulation_number}, Class {device_class}). Does FDA agree with this classification?
questions.rationale: Classification confirmation is mandatory for all Pre-Subs - ensures regulatory pathway alignment

questions.text: Our device has characteristics that may fall under multiple product codes ({product_codes_list}). Which product code does FDA recommend for classification?
questions.rationale: Product code ambiguity can delay review - early FDA determination prevents submission errors

questions.text: We propose biocompatibility testing per ISO 10993-1:2018 for {contact_type} contact with {contact_duration} duration. Does FDA agree this testing strategy is sufficient, or does FDA recommend additional endpoints?
questions.rationale: Biocompatibility is critical safety concern for patient-contacting devices - FDA input reduces RTA risk

questions.text: Our device uses {materials_list}. Based on predicate precedent, we propose the following ISO 10993-1 endpoints: {proposed_endpoints}. Does FDA agree, or does FDA recommend additional testing?
questions.rationale: Novel materials require comprehensive biocompatibility characterization - endpoint selection is critical

questions.text: We propose sterilization validation per {sterilization_standard} using {sterilization_method}. Does FDA agree this approach is sufficient?
questions.rationale: Sterilization validation is critical for sterile devices - FDA must confirm method appropriateness
questions.fda_guidance: Submission and Review of Sterility Information (2019)

questions.text: We propose a {shelf_life_years}-year shelf life supported by accelerated aging per ASTM F1980. Does FDA agree with this shelf life claim and testing approach?
questions.rationale: Shelf life claims require robust validation - FDA input on accelerated aging protocols prevents rejection

questions.text: We propose the following performance testing: {performance_tests_list}. Does FDA agree this testing adequately demonstrates device performance, or does FDA recommend additional tests?
questions.rationale: Performance testing expectations vary by device type - FDA alignment prevents costly re-testing

questions.text: We propose electrical safety testing per IEC 60601-1 and EMC testing per IEC 60601-1-2. Does FDA agree this approach is sufficient for our {device_type}?
questions.rationale: Electrical safety is critical for powered devices - IEC 60601 series compliance is typically expected

questions.text: Our device includes software with documentation level {software_level}. We propose software validation per IEC 62304 and usability engineering per IEC 62366-1. Does FDA agree this approach is sufficient?
questions.rationale: Software validation requirements are complex - early FDA alignment on documentation level prevents deficiencies
questions.fda_guidance: Content of Premarket Submissions for Device Software Functions (2023)

questions.text: Our device has {connectivity_type} connectivity. We propose cybersecurity validation per FDA's 2023 guidance. Does FDA agree with this approach, or does FDA recommend additional cybersecurity measures?
questions.rationale: Cybersecurity is mandatory for connected devices - FDA guidance (2023) requires specific documentation
questions.fda_guidance: Cybersecurity in Medical Devices: Quality System Considerations and Content of Premarket Submissions (2023)

questions.text: We propose human factors validation per IEC 62366-1 with {hf_study_type}. Does FDA agree this approach adequately addresses use-related risks identified in our risk analysis?
questions.rationale: Human factors is critical for devices with complex UI or home use - study design must address use errors
questions.fda_guidance: Applying Human Factors and Usability Engineering to Medical Devices (2016)

questions.text: Based on predicate precedent showing {clinical_precedent_summary}, does FDA expect clinical data for our submission? If so, what study design would FDA recommend?
questions.rationale: Clinical data expectations vary widely by device type - FDA clarity prevents wasted resources
questions.fda_guidance: Clinical Evidence for Clearance or Approval of Medical Devices (2022)

questions.text: We propose to support our submission with clinical data from {clinical_data_source}. Does FDA consider this sufficient, or does FDA recommend a prospective clinical study?
questions.rationale: Prospective vs retrospective clinical evidence has different regulatory weight - FDA input is critical

questions.text: We propose a clinical study with the following design: {study_design_summary}. Does FDA agree with this approach, or does FDA recommend modifications to the study protocol?
questions.rationale: Clinical study protocol must be aligned with FDA expectations before initiation - prevents study failures

questions.text: We propose the following primary endpoint: {primary_endpoint}. Does FDA agree this endpoint adequately demonstrates device safety and effectiveness?
questions.rationale: Primary endpoint selection is critical for study success - FDA must confirm clinical relevance

questions.text: Do FDA and our IRB consider this device to be a significant risk (SR) or non-significant risk (NSR) device for the purposes of the proposed clinical study?
questions.rationale: SR vs NSR determination affects IDE requirements - early FDA determination streamlines study initiation
questions.fda_guidance: Significant Risk and Nonsignificant Risk Medical Device Studies (2006)

questions.text: Our device includes {novel_feature_description} not present in the proposed predicate. What additional data, if any, does FDA recommend to address this design difference?
questions.rationale: Novel features are primary SE barrier - early FDA input prevents costly testing mistakes
questions.fda_guidance: The 510(k) Program: Evaluating Substantial Equivalence (2014), Section VI

questions.text: Given the novel {technology_aspect}, does FDA agree the 510(k) pathway remains appropriate, or should we consider the De Novo pathway?
questions.rationale: Pathway determination is critical early decision - incorrect pathway wastes significant time and resources

questions.text: Our proposed indications for use extend beyond the predicate to include {ifu_extension}. Does FDA consider this within the scope of substantial equivalence, or does FDA recommend narrowing the indications?
questions.rationale: IFU scope directly impacts SE determination - FDA must confirm acceptability of extensions

questions.text: Does FDA agree our proposed indications for use ({proposed_ifu_summary}) are appropriately specific for a Class {device_class} device?
questions.rationale: IFU specificity requirements vary by device class - FDA input ensures regulatory alignment

questions.text: Based on predicate labeling precedent, we propose the following key labeling elements: {labeling_elements}. Does FDA agree this labeling is adequate?
questions.rationale: Labeling deficiencies are common RTA reason - early FDA review prevents rejection

questions.text: Our device will include the following warnings and precautions: {warnings_list}. Does FDA recommend additional warnings based on the device risk profile?
questions.rationale: Warning adequacy is critical for risk mitigation - FDA input ensures comprehensive risk communication

questions.text: Our device will be manufactured at {manufacturing_location}. Does FDA foresee any regulatory concerns with this manufacturing location?
questions.rationale: Manufacturing location can impact review timeline - early disclosure identifies potential issues

questions.text: We propose to make the following manufacturing changes compared to the predicate: {manufacturing_changes}. Does FDA consider these changes to impact substantial equivalence?
questions.rationale: Manufacturing changes can raise SE concerns - FDA input clarifies if validation data is needed

questions.text: Based on our analysis, we believe the {proposed_pathway} pathway is appropriate for this device. Does FDA agree, or does FDA recommend an alternative pathway?
questions.rationale: Pathway confirmation is fundamental decision - incorrect pathway wastes months of effort

questions.text: Given the absence of {missing_element}, are there any special considerations or additional data FDA would recommend to support the {proposed_pathway} pathway?
questions.rationale: Pathway gaps (e.g., no clear predicate) require strategic FDA alignment

questions.text: We are considering both the 510(k) and De Novo pathways for this device. What factors should we prioritize in making this strategic decision?
questions.rationale: Strategic pathway selection requires FDA input when both options are viable

questions.text: Our device is reusable and will be reprocessed {reprocessing_cycles} times. We propose reprocessing validation per {reprocessing_standard}. Does FDA agree this approach is sufficient?
questions.rationale: Reprocessing validation is critical for reusable devices - FDA guidance requires specific documentation
questions.fda_guidance: Reprocessing Medical Devices in Health Care Settings (2015)

questions.text: Our device includes a {drug_component} component. We believe the device is the primary mode of action. Does FDA agree with this classification, or should we pursue a combination product designation?
questions.rationale: Combination product designation determines lead center (CDRH vs CDER) - early determination is critical
questions.fda_guidance: Classification of Products as Drugs and Devices (2018)

questions.text: We propose to use the following FDA-recognized consensus standards: {standards_list}. Does FDA agree these standards adequately address the device-specific risks?
questions.rationale: Standards selection must map to device risks - FDA confirmation ensures comprehensive testing coverage

questions.text: We are planning to submit our 510(k) in {submission_timeline}. Are there any known review delays or backlogs for {product_code} devices that we should consider in our timeline planning?
questions.rationale: Review timeline awareness supports strategic planning - FDA transparency on backlogs is valuable

questions.text: We previously submitted {prior_submission_type} for a related device ({prior_k_number}). Are there any carryover considerations or lessons learned from that submission that FDA recommends we address?
questions.rationale: Prior submission history can impact review approach - FDA input on carryover issues is valuable

categories.predicate_selection: Questions about predicate device selection and acceptability
categories.classification: Questions about device classification and product code
categories.testing_biocompatibility: Biocompatibility testing strategy and ISO 10993 compliance
categories.testing_shelf_life: Shelf life claims and accelerated aging
categories.testing_electrical: Electrical safety and EMC testing (IEC 60601 series)
categories.clinical_evidence: Clinical data requirements and study design
categories.clinical_study_design: Clinical study protocol, endpoints, and IRB considerations
